main event: On 28 June 1949, observers in Dayton, Ohio reported seeing a ball of fire in the sky, described as larger than the sun, with a deep reddish orange color and a fiery tail.
interesting points: The object was first attracted to attention by a hissing sound resembling compressed air escaping., Witnesses described the object as having the brightness of the sun and about five feet in diameter., The object emitted sparks brighter than welding sparks., It traveled from west to east at a slight decline and disappeared behind buildings., Multiple witnesses reported seeing similar sightings on different dates in close proximity.
sighted object: a ball of fire with a fiery tail
witness description: Various witnesses including a welder and an insurance agent.
